com.ephesoft.dcma.webservice.util

Class WebServiceHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ephesoft.dcma.webservice.util.WebServiceHelper

  • public class WebServiceHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Web service Helper class is used for providing all the functionality required for processing of web service.

    3.0

    Ephesoft
    See Also:

      • validateCreateBatchClassParameters

        public static java.lang.String validateCreateBatchClassParameters(java.lang.String batchClassName,
                                                  java.lang.String batchClassDescription,
                                                  java.lang.String batchClassPriority,
                                                  java.lang.String batchUNCFolder,
                                                  java.lang.String batchClassID,
                                                  java.lang.String gridWorkflow)
        This method is used to validate the input parameters for create batch class parameters.
        Parameters:
        batchClassName - String batch class name to be created.
        batchClassDescription - String batch class description to be created.
        batchClassPriority - String batch class priority to be created.
        batchUNCFolder - String batch class unc folder path to be created.
        batchClassID - String batch class identifier from which it has to be copied.
        gridWorkflow - String batch class grid workflow deployment variable.
        Returns:
        String return string carries the result of validation. If string is empty then it means that parameters are validated, otherwise the error statement is returned.

      • getBatchClassIdentifiersForRole

        public ListValues getBatchClassIdentifiersForRole(java.lang.String role)
                                           throws ValidationException
        This is an helper API for the request of getting Batch Class Identifiers by role to the user. It returns the ListValues corresponding to the Object
        Parameters:
        role - String The Role Corresponding to which the Batch Class instances are required
        Returns:
        ListValues of the Batch Class identifiers corresponding to the role
        Throws:
        ValidationException - When the input cannot be validated to the request

      • getBatchInstanceIdentifiersForRole

        public ListValues getBatchInstanceIdentifiersForRole(java.lang.String role)
                                              throws ValidationException

        Parameters:
        role - String role corresponding to which the Batch instances are required
        Returns:
        ListValues of the Batch Instances
        Throws:
        ValidationException - when could not validate the Input role.

      • getAllModulesWorkflowNameByBatchClass

        public Modules getAllModulesWorkflowNameByBatchClass(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> loggedInUserRole,
                                            java.lang.String identifier,
                                            boolean isBatchClassViewable)
                                              throws ValidationException,
                                                     UnAuthorisedAccessException
        Gets the all WorkFlow name and the module name of the Batch Class Identifier as requested by the Client in the Request
        Parameters:
        loggedInUserRole - Set Roles specifed for the user
        identifier - String Batch Class identifier which is the Name of the Batch Class Identifier
        isBatchClassViewable - boolean It is t5he flag which determines that the Batch Class is Visible to the user or not
        Returns:
        Modules All the modules and the work Flow names
        Throws:
        ValidationException - The validation exception - in case some parameter is not valid.
        UnAuthorisedAccessException - the un authorised access exception - in case user does not have access to the passed batch class.

      • restartBatchInstance

        public java.lang.String restartBatchInstance(java.lang.String identifier,
                                    java.lang.String moduleName,
                                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> loggedInUserRole,
                                    boolean isSuperAdmin)
                                      throws UnAuthorisedAccessException,
                                             ValidationException,
                                             InternalServerException
        This Web Service Helper restarts the batch Instance whose identifier is passed as an argument. This whill throw an exception if it could not restart the Batch else would process the request and return a success/failure Message
        Parameters:
        identifier - String The identity of the Batch instance Batch Instance Identifier
        moduleName - String name of the Module from which the batch is supposed to be restarted
        loggedInUserRole - Set The roles assigned to the logged in user
        isSuperAdmin - Boolean The flag which determines whether the user is a super admin or not
        Returns:
        Success or error message after processing the request. Which is the information regarding the process
        Throws:
        UnAuthorisedAccessException - When the user is not authenticated to make the request
        ValidationException - When the input parameters are not validated
        InternalServerException - When the Server could not process the request due to some reason or some lock acquired on the batch class

      • restartAllBatchInstance

        public java.lang.String restartAllBatchInstance(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> loggedInUserRole,
                                       boolean isSuperAdmin)
                                         throws InternalServerException
        WebService Helper which will restart all the Batched in the REVIEW and the VALIDATION phase
        Parameters:
        loggedInUserRole - Set Roles assigned to the User
        isSuperAdmin - Boolean Flag that determines that the user is a Super Admin or not
        Returns:
        the success/failure message defining whether the Request is processed or not and raise an exception when culdnot validate the request
        Throws:
        InternalServerException - When could not process the Request

      • deleteBatchInstance

        public java.lang.String deleteBatchInstance(java.lang.String identifier,
                                   java.util.Set<java.lang.String> loggedInUserRole,
                                   boolean isSuperAdmin)
                                     throws ValidationException,
                                            UnAuthorisedAccessException,
                                            InternalServerException
        Delete batch instance and return the Success or the error Message when it tries to process the request and raise an exception when unable to process the request
        Parameters:
        identifier - PathVariable The path variable which is the identifier of the batch instance to be deleted
        loggedInUserRole - Set Set of the roles the user is assigned to.
        isSuperAdmin - Boolean The flag which determines the user is SuperAdmin or not
        Returns:
        the success/error message when process the request
        Throws:
        ValidationException - When could not validate the input provided
        UnAuthorisedAccessException - When the user is not authorized to make the request.
        InternalServerException - When the request could not be processed by the server or any run time exception being generated
        DCMAApplicationException

      • getBatchClassList

        public BatchClasses getBatchClassList(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> loggedInUserRole,
                             boolean isSuperAdmin)
                               throws UnAuthorisedAccessException
        Gets the batch class list defined for the User. These Batch class roles would be different for the Super Admin which would not account for the deleted ones
        Parameters:
        loggedInUserRole - Set nSet of roles assigned to the Logged in user
        isSuperAdmin - Boolean Flag that determines that the user is a super Admin or not
        Returns:
        BatchClasses That is List representation of the BatchClass
        Throws:
        UnAuthorisedAccessException - When the user is not authorised to make the req

      • getRoles

        public ListValues getRoles(java.lang.String identifier,
                  java.util.Set<java.lang.String> loggedInUserRole,
                  boolean isSuperAdmin,
                  boolean isBatchClassViewableToUser)
                    throws ValidationException,
                           UnAuthorisedAccessException
        The Helper method for the Web Service API which defines the working of fetching the roles on the Batch Class. It returns the values of roles
        Parameters:
        identifier - String The Batch Class Identifier received from the request
        loggedInUserRole - Set The Set of Roles defined for the User that has logged in
        isSuperAdmin - Boolean defines whether the user is Super-Admin or not
        isBatchClassViewableToUser - Boolean Defines whether the Batch is Visible to User or not
        Returns:
        ListValues The list Values that defines the Roles as on the Batch Class Idenitifer
        Throws:
        ValidationException - ValidationException When there is some Validation issue this Exception would be raised
        UnAuthorisedAccessException - UnAuthorisedAccessException When the user is not allowed to make the request

      • uploadBatch

        public java.lang.String uploadBatch(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                           java.lang.String batchClassIdentifier,
                           java.lang.String batchInstanceName,
                           java.util.Set<java.lang.String> roles)
                             throws ValidationException,
                                    UnAuthorisedAccessException,
                                    NoUserRoleException,
                                    UnSupportedFileTypeException,
                                    BatchNameAlreadyExistException,
                                    InternalServerException,
                                    java.lang.Exception
        This Web Service implements the functionality of uploading the Batch and creating the new BatchInstances with the name provided by the user making sure that the there is no Other Batch Instance with the same name under that Batch class and as well as the user has the access to that Batch Class
        Parameters:
        req - HttpServletRequest The request Object encapsulated for the clients Request
        batchClassIdentifier - String Batch Class Identifier which uniquely Identifies the Object
        batchInstanceName - String Batch Instance Name that is the unique name which identifies the batch Instance
        roles - Set Set of the roles assigned to the user
        Returns:
        String the Result to be displaying When the Request is executed successfully withoput generating an Exception
        Throws:
        ValidationException - When the Input Parameters cannot be validated
        UnAuthorisedAccessException - When User tries to make an access to a batch which is not under his role
        NoUserRoleException - : When the user is not assigned to any role
        UnSupportedFileTypeException - : When the uploaded file is not from any of the supprted file type by plugin pdf/tif/tiff
        BatchNameAlreadyExistException - : The Batch With same Name aslready exist
        InternalServerException - : When Some IOException Occurs at Server
        java.lang.Exception - When unable to process the Multi-Part Request

      • importBatchClass

        public java.lang.String importBatchClass(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpRequest)
                                  throws ValidationException,
                                         InternalServerException,
                                         java.lang.Exception
        Function of the Helper Class which helps the web services to handle the Request of importing the Batch Class. It process the request but raises an Exception when could not process the Request
        Parameters:
        httpRequest - HttpServletRequest The request made by the client encapsulated as an object
        Returns:
        success or error Message When an exception is not raised after processing the request
        Throws:
        ValidationException - : When could not validate the input or input condition required for the request
        InternalServerException - : When input is valid but server could not process the request
        java.lang.Exception - : In case of any un-expected Failure

                                                                                                                          throws ValidationException
        A utility function which check that the request is an MultiPart HTTP Request or not. If its a multiPart request then returns the multipartHTTPServletRequest else throws a validation Exception

      • isExistingFixedFormExtractionFile

        public boolean isExistingFixedFormExtractionFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                        java.lang.String batchClassID)
        Checks whether or not the RSP File actually Exist under the BatchClass.

        It accepts the name of the filename and the Batch Class ID. and returns false when any of them is invalid or null.

        Parameters:
        fileName - : name of the File to be searched should be a valid fileName
        batchClassID - : the identifier of the Batch Class.
        Returns:
        : true if the file exist , else false.

                          int errorCode)

        Parameters:
        errorMessage - is the error message
        errorDeveloperMessage - is more detailed message
        errorCode - is the error code
        Returns:
        RestError which encapsulates all the above

      • decryptReportingBatchXML

        public Batch decryptReportingBatchXML(java.lang.String batchInstanceIdentifier,
                             java.lang.String moduleName,
                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpRequest)
                               throws java.lang.Exception,
                                      InternalServerException,
                                      NoUserRoleException,
                                      ValidationException,
                                      java.io.IOException,
                                      KeyNotFoundException
        Decrypts plugin batch xml file of a batch instance folder located in report-data backup.
        Parameters:
        batchInstanceIdentifier - String The batch instance identifier.
        moduleName - String The name of plugin.
        httpRequest - HttpServletRequest The request Object from the client.
        Returns:
        Batch object for plugin xml file.
        Throws:
        InternalServerException - if xml file is not found.
        NoUserRoleException - if logged in user has not enough permissions to perform the operations.
        ValidationException - if batchInstanceIdentifier and pluginName is invalid.
        java.io.IOException - if report-data folder path is not resolved.
        KeyNotFoundException - if encryption key is not found.
        java.lang.Exception - if any other error condition occurs.

      • decryptHocrXML

        public HocrPages decryptHocrXML(java.lang.String xmlFilePath)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns unmarshalled HocrPages object after decrypting specified HOCR xml file.
        Parameters:
        xmlFilePath - String HOCR xml file's path.
        Returns:
        unmarshalled HocrPages object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case of errornous condition occurs.

      • validateUserForBatchInstance
